excerpt: Public palm-lined sandy beach used by resorts with kitesurfing schools & bar & restaurant access.
detail_description: Playa Dorada is a stunning beach in the Dominican Republic, known for its palm-lined golden sands and crystal-clear waters. It's not just a beach; it's a destination offering luxury and relaxation. The area provides various activities, from kitesurfing to exploring waterfalls at 27 Charcos de Damajagua and snorkeling at Cayo Arena. Visitors can also immerse themselves in local culture by visiting nearby villages, trying Dominican cuisine, or learning about cocoa and coffee plantations.
name: Playa Dorada
address: 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Flashy attraction featuring multiple animal encounters, like swimming with sharks & dolphins.
detail_description: Ocean World Adventure Park in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic is a vibrant attraction offering various animal encounters such as swimming with sharks and dolphins. The north coast area also provides numerous activities like fishing, snorkeling, diving, surfing, golfing at Playa Dorada, and more. Visitors can enjoy go-karting at Fun City or explore the historic district of Puerto Plata with its Victorian pink alleyway and Umbrella Street.
name: Ocean World Adventure Park, Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
address: Beach Cofresi Beach, Calle Principal #3, Cofresi, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Pico Isabel de Torres is home to the Cable Car Puerto Plata, the only one in the Caribbean, which takes visitors to the top of Loma Isabel de Torres and its stunning botanical garden. From there, you can enjoy a panoramic view of the Atlantic coast with over 100 kilometers of beautiful beaches.
name: Pico Isabel de Torres
address: 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Spanish fort dating to the late 1500s & built to defend against pirates, with history displays.
detail_description: Fortaleza de San Felipe is a historic Spanish fortress built in the late 1500s to defend against pirates and invaders. Located on a hill at the Puntilla Del Malecon, it overlooks the Atlantic Ocean and protected the entrance to Puerto Plata's seaport. The fort offers fully narrated tours around its grounds, showcasing history displays and old cannons pointing out to sea.
name: Fortaleza de San Felipe
address: Puerto Plata Harbor LightHouse, Parque San Felipe, Av. Gral. Gregorio Luperón, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: San Felipe de Puerto Plata is the capital of the Puerto Plata province on the Dominican Republic’s Atlantic north coast. The city is best known for its beaches. Playa Dorada’s lengthy beachfront is backed by resorts and an 18-hole golf course. The city’s old colonial-era center is dominated by the 16th-century Fortaleza San Felipe, a Spanish fortress that now houses historical and military artifacts.
detail_description: Puerto Plata, also known as San Felipe de Puerto Plata, is the capital of the Puerto Plata province in the Dominican Republic. The city boasts Playa Dorada, a beautiful beachfront lined with resorts and an 18-hole golf course. Visitors can explore the old colonial-era center dominated by the 16th-century Fortaleza San Felipe, which now houses historical and military artifacts.
name: Puerto Plata
address: 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Caribbean's only cable car with views over a mountain with its Christ statue & Puerto Plata city.
detail_description: The Puerto Plata Cable Car, also known as Teleferico, is the only one of its kind in the Caribbean. It offers a scenic 15-minute ride to the top of Mount Isabel de Torres, where visitors can explore botanical gardens and visit the iconic Christ the Redeemer statue. From this vantage point, at 2,600 feet above sea level, guests can take in breathtaking panoramic views of Puerto Plata city and its coastline stretching over 100 kilometers along the Atlantic Ocean.
name: Puerto Plata Cable Car
address: C. del Teleférico, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Malecón de Puerto Plata is a picturesque beachside boardwalk that stretches from Long Beach to the city center. It offers stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean and the Statue of Neptune, as well as palm-bordered beaches with clear waters. The area is lined with a variety of bars and restaurants, making it perfect for leisurely walks, bike rides, or people-watching. Visitors can also explore the colonial museum at Fortaleza and stroll through town to visit shops and the local church.
name: Malecón de Puerto Plata
address: R825+59W, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Museum with exhibits on the life & works of General Gregorio Luperón in a historic home.
detail_description: Casa Museo General Gregorio Luperón is a historic museum located in Puerto Plata, dedicated to the life and legacy of General Gregorio Luperón, a prominent figure in the fight for Dominican independence from Spain. The museum is housed in a well-preserved historic home and features exhibits that bring to life the history of Puerto Plata and the significant role played by General Luperón.
name: Casa Museo General Gregorio Luperón
address: C. 12 de Julio 57, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Cofresi offers a tranquil swimming experience with its calm waters and various options for shaded relaxation, including umbrellas, huts, and trees. Visitors can enjoy the free and accessible Cofresi Beach, bordered by several dining establishments, while also having the convenience of the nearby Ocean World Adventure Park.
name: Cofresi
address: 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Umbrella Street in Puerto Plata is a must-see attraction located in the historic part of the city. The street is adorned with brightly-colored umbrellas, creating a picturesque setting that's perfect for photography. This vibrant spot has become popular among tourists, especially when cruise ships dock, bringing a lively atmosphere. However, during quieter times, it offers a glimpse into local life and becomes an ideal place for people-watching and unique photo opportunities.
name: Umbrella Street
address: Q8X4+964, C. San Felipe, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Del Oro Chocolate Factory in Puerto Plata is a delightful destination for families and chocolate lovers alike. This charming factory specializes in organic Dominican cocoa, offering visitors an immersive experience into the world of chocolate production. As you step inside, the irresistible aroma of rich chocolate envelops you, setting the stage for a memorable visit. The tour includes informative videos about cocoa cultivation in the Dominican Republic and engaging demonstrations on how chocolate is crafted using various machinery.
name: Del Oro Chocolate Factory
address: C. Principal, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Cofresí Beach, located about 5km east of Puerto Plata, is a popular destination with a 12 km stretch of sand perfect for various activities such as walking, jogging, swimming, diving, and snorkeling. On Sundays, the beach turns into a lively house party with locals enjoying picnics, barbecues, and merengue music that lasts well into the night.
name: Cofresí Beach
address: R7CC+5CH, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Taíno Bay Cruise Port, located in the heart of San Felipe near the old ship port, has become a popular destination for cruise ship passengers. The port offers easy access to General Gregorio Luperon Avenue and is surrounded by numerous restaurants and shops offering duty-free goods. While some construction standards may seem lax, the area provides a tropical paradise for tourists with friendly staff and amenities such as a pool and beach area.
name: Taíno Bay Cruise Port
address: Av. Antigua Via Férrea Muelle Turístico entre Av. Penetración Portuaria y, Calle Duarte, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Fun City Action Park in Puerto Plata is the ultimate destination for thrill-seekers and families alike. With various go-kart tracks catering to different skill levels, it's a haven for those seeking an adrenaline rush. The park offers a nostalgic escape from digital activities, allowing visitors to embrace physical fun. From go-kart racing to a kid's playground and refreshment stand, there's something for everyone at Fun City.
name: Fun City
address: P9W7+2V6, fun city, Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Golden Beach One Bedroom Apartment is located in the beautiful Playa Dorada, known for its market at one end and a string of resorts along the north. The beach offers clear, calm waters and soft white sand perfect for relaxation. Visitors have praised the attentive service and tranquil atmosphere, making it an excellent choice for a peaceful getaway.
name: Golden Beach One Bedroom Apartment
address: Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: The Cathedral of St. Philip the Apostle, situated in the heart of Puerto Plata's historic center, is a stunning example of modern Victorian architecture and holds significant cultural and historical value. Originally established in 1502, the current cathedral was constructed in the 20th century after being destroyed by fire in 1863. It stands as one of the most popular religious attractions on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, drawing numerous tourists eager to explore its rich history and architectural beauty.
name: Cathedral of St. Philip the Apostle
address: C. José del Carmen Ariza 36, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: A hike or cablecar leads to a mountaintop in this lush park featuring a garden & a Christ statue.
detail_description: Isabel de Torres National Park is a lush and beautiful mountain park in Puerto Plata, offering stunning views of the city. Visitors can reach the mountaintop via a cable car or hiking trails to explore its botanical garden with over 2,000 native plant species. The park is also home to picturesque waterfalls and diverse bird species. It's a great place to escape the hustle and bustle of Puerto Plata and immerse yourself in nature.
name: Isabel de Torres National Park
address: Q77Q+9QW, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Mares restaurant in Puerto Plata is a top-notch dining spot overseen by Chef Rafael Vasquez. The restaurant boasts a brilliant decor and an outdoor garden for patrons to savor their meals and drinks. Specializing in Caribbean fusion cuisine, the menu offers a variety of dishes such as fish with a French twist and sushi with a Caribbean flair. Located next to the beach, Mares is known for its exquisite selection of seafood-based dishes, particularly the fresh fish cooked in coconut sauce.
name: Mares restaurant
address: Francisco J. Peinado 6, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Low-key beach close to cafes & bars, known for its wide sandy expanse & surfable waves.
detail_description: Nestled along the vibrant Malecon of Puerto Plata, Cosita Rica Beach is a hidden gem that perfectly embodies the essence of relaxation and fun. With its expansive golden sands and gentle waves, this beach is ideal for families looking to enjoy a day in the sun. The shallow waters make it safe for children to splash around while adults can indulge in various activities like volleyball or simply lounging under an umbrella with a refreshing drink.
name: cosita rica beach
address: 57000, Dominican Republic

name: Loma Isabel de Torres
address: Q7CQ+97, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Amber Cove, also known as the Amber Coast, is located in Puerto Plata, which is famous for its production of the oldest and most translucent amber in the world. Visitors can tour amber mines in the hills of La Cumbre and purchase authentic amber jewelry from local vendors. The area offers plenty of shopping opportunities at Playa Dorada, where visitors can find mamajuana bottles, beachwear, and local fruits.
name: Amber Cove Excursions
address: Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Puerto Plata, known as the Silver Port, is a vibrant destination that offers a rich tapestry of history and culture. Beyond its stunning Cathedral and central park, visitors can explore an array of landmark restaurants, shops, and markets that are essential to both historians and tourists alike. A highlight is La Casita Azul Restaurant, renowned for its exquisite cuisine. Just around the corner lies Island Treasures gift shop where you can find unique local crafts.
name: Puerto Plata
address: Q7RW+GM7, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Brugal & Co. Souvenirs Store in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic is a must-visit for rum enthusiasts. As the largest producer of traditional Dominican rum, it offers an immersive tour of its facilities, providing insight into the meticulous process of rum-making from fermentation to aging, and includes delightful tasting sessions. The Brugal Factory showcases the origin and history of Brugal Rum dating back to 1888.
name: Brugal & Co. Souvenils Store, Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
address: Q8JJ+4JM, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Independencia Central Park is a beloved gathering spot for locals and visitors alike, offering a charming atmosphere perfect for leisurely strolls or simply relaxing on the numerous benches. The park is beautifully framed by colonial buildings adorned in vibrant hues, creating a picturesque backdrop. When exploring Puerto Plata, taking a few moments to wander through this lively square is essential. For those seeking an elevated perspective, head over to Chocolate Bakery & Cafe where you can indulge in delightful hot chocolate while enjoying stunning views of the park below.
name: Independencia Central Park
address: Q8X4+CJ2, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Museum in a Victorian building featuring insects preserved in amber & a shop selling amber jewelry.
detail_description: Museo del Ámbar Dominicano, located in a Victorian building, is a must-visit attraction in Puerto Plata. It houses a unique collection of valuable Dominican amber, known for its exceptional transparency. The museum offers an immersive experience into the world of this semiprecious resin, transporting visitors back to the time of the Taino people. Visitors can explore ancient artifacts and stunning amber jewelry while learning about the island's rich amber deposits.
name: Museo del Ámbar Dominicano
address: Calle Duarte. 61 con, C. Emilio Prud'Homme, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: When visiting Puerto Plata, a must-visit destination is the Macorix House of Rum. This tour offers an escape from the afternoon heat and provides insight into the creation process of locally made Dominican rums. Visitors can sample various flavors such as Coco Splash and Pineapple Rums. The guided tour, which costs $8 per person, covers the history of rum, the company, barrel aging, and different types of rum.
name: Macorix House of Rum
address: Av. Francisco Alberto Caamaño, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Playa de Long Beach is one of the uncrowded spots in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic, where tourists can enjoy the best of the Caribbean at a low cost. This beach offers various water sports such as jet skiing, surfing, windsurfing, kite surfing, and sailing. For those into world-class kite surfing, Cabarete is the place to be.
name: Playa de Long Beach
address: Dominican Republic

detail_description: Restaurant Le Papillon is a charming and unique dining spot that offers a mix of Caribbean and Dominican-inspired cuisine. The restaurant features an outdoor section, making it an ideal choice for a leisurely lunch in the sunshine. With its rustic nautical design, Le Papillon provides a relaxed tropical atmosphere for fine dining. The small eatery boasts quirky decor including large aquariums and historic artifacts, creating an inviting ambiance.
name: Restaurant Le Papillon
address: Villas Cofresi, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Located in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic, Big Lee's Beach Bar & Grill has been a popular spot since its opening in 2011. Situated by the Cosita Rica Beach with a view of the North Atlantic Ocean, it attracts both locals and tourists, including cruise passengers. The bar offers a lively atmosphere day and night, featuring classic rock music and karaoke. With its beachfront location, patrons can enjoy swimming after indulging in delicious drinks and food.
name: Big Lee's Beach Bar & Grill
address: Casetta #8 with full roof, Av. Gral. Gregorio Luperón, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Los Tres Cocos is a popular restaurant known for its warm and inviting atmosphere, offering a variety of daring dishes alongside traditional Dominican flavors. Nestled in a tropical setting, this intimate location serves gourmet meals including Caribbean favorites and vegetarian options. Freshly caught fish and grilled specialties like steak and lamb chops are among the highlights. The restaurant's charming decor adds to the overall dining experience, making it an ideal choice for a romantic outing.
name: Los Tres Cocos
address: R74F+R59, La Roka, Cofresi 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Casita Azul, a charming Victorian-style restaurant located near the Parque Central in Puerto Plata, offers a magical dining experience with its simplistic Caribbean elegance. The quaint and elegant ambiance inside takes you back to a time of civility and fine dining. Meanwhile, the front patio provides a perfect spot to soak in the historic atmosphere while enjoying breakfast or sipping on wine. Its romantic Victorian style adds to its appeal for both travelers and locals.
name: Casita Azul
address: C. Beller No.40, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Green Jack Tar is a Caribbean and vegetarian restaurant located in a relaxed atmosphere at Blue JackTar resort in Puerto Plata. The restaurant offers exquisite cuisine made from fresh ingredients, including dishes like Ensalada Capresa Mediterranea with grilled mozzarella, tomatoes, eggplants, zucchinis, and peppers.
name: Green Jack Tar *
address: Playa Dorada, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque Costa Dorada area, Le Petit Francois is a delightful beach-front restaurant that offers an eclectic menu featuring Dominican, Italian, French, and American dishes. Guests rave about the delectable lobster, calamari, and Caesar salad. The inviting deck provides stunning sea views that enhance your dining experience. While it can get lively and crowded as the day progresses—especially with a DJ spinning tunes on Sundays—the friendly staff ensures you feel right at home.
name: Le petit François
address: Playa Dorada, G1, Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Kviar Show Disco & Casino Puerto Plata is a popular entertainment spot in the city, offering a unique combination of casino and show venue. The establishment provides a Las Vegas-like experience with its working casino, club atmosphere, live entertainment, DJs, and themed nights. Visitors can enjoy various games such as slots, table games, and blackjack at the casino while also indulging in nightly live performances at the show disco.
name: Kviar Show Disco & Casino Puerto Plata
address: Carretera Luperón Km. 4,5, Complejo turístico Costa Dorada, Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Pop Cinemas, conveniently situated within the Playa Dorada Mall, showcases highly anticipated first-run movies from the United States. With affordable ticket prices and reasonably priced refreshments, this theater offers a fantastic movie-watching experience. For approximately $5.00, patrons have the opportunity to enjoy blockbusters like Avengers, Spider-Man, and Star Wars upon their initial release.
name: Pop Cinemas
address: C. Principal playa dorada 538, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

name: Rancho Lorilar
address: calle maranatha, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Located in the Dominican Republic, (ACCOUNTING OFFICE) Country World Adventure Park offers an unforgettable experience for visitors. The park features a range of activities including horseback riding, ATV rides, and 8 thrilling ziplines that provide stunning views of river valleys and mango trees. Visitors can also enjoy a refreshing pool zip splash and indulge in a delicious lunch with bottled water. The family-owned park is known for its friendly and professional staff who ensure the safety and enjoyment of all guests.
name: (ACCOUNTING OFFICE) Country World Adventure Park
address: Accounting Office Only, C. Principal 10, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: This small, sandy beach alongside a road is surrounded by trees & offers swimming & sunbathing.
detail_description: Acapulco Beach is a small, sandy beach located near a road and surrounded by trees. It's known for its proximity to the city and is just a 20-minute walk from the social section of Long Beach. Despite being close to a busy highway, visitors can enjoy a serene experience by the ethereal ocean. The beach tends to be deserted, except for local families who frequent it on weekends. It's an ideal spot for sunbathing, swimming, and capturing memorable photos.
name: Acapulco beach
address: 57000 Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Panoramic waterfront park next to Fort San Felipe featuring a modern amphitheater for live events.
detail_description: La Puntilla Park, located next to Fort San Felipe in Puerto Plata, is a picturesque waterfront park with a modern amphitheater that hosts live events. The park is a hub of cultural and community activities, offering performances ranging from classical to contemporary music. Visitors can enjoy the serene atmosphere of the park, adorned with sculptures and green spaces overlooking the Atlantic Ocean.
name: La Puntilla Park
address: Av. Gral. Gregorio Luperón Av, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Residencial Lucia is a versatile dining option, offering a formal and glamorous atmosphere with exquisite cuisine. It's perfect for those seeking an elegant dinner experience. On the other hand, if you're looking for a more relaxed setting where you can comfortably dine in shorts and sandals, there are also casual options like La Carihuela and Pizzeria Stefy e Natale.
name: Residencial Lucia
address: Q8H9+PFP, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Experience the vibrant culture of Puerto Plata with a city tour that takes you to Central Park, the Cathedral, and lively markets. Immerse yourself in local stories shared by residents. Then, embark on an open-air safari truck tour through the Dominican countryside before unwinding at Playa Dorada Beach. Indulge in a delightful coffee and rum tasting for a complete sensory experience.
name: Puerto Plata City Tour
address: Calle El Morro 10, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Lis & Liz Tea and Coffee Room is a charming coffee and tea shop located in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. It's a perfect spot for families to enjoy quality time together. The place offers delicious coffee, delightful pastries, and reasonable prices. Visitors also appreciate the excellent service provided at this beautiful establishment. Additionally, it serves as a great location for capturing memorable photos.
name: Lis & Liz Tea and Coffee Room
address: Jimenez Hogar, C. Cam. Real 18, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

excerpt: Happening tourist stop with a high-energy pool area featuring a swim-up bar, loungers & cabanas.
detail_description: Amber Cove Cruise Port is a vibrant tourist destination with a lively pool area featuring a swim-up bar, loungers, and cabanas. The port offers an array of exciting shore excursions and adventures such as waterfall experiences, city tours, ATV quad tours, river tubing, zip-lining, hiking, and horseback riding. With historical significance dating back to Christopher Columbus' arrival in 1493, the area boasts stunning views of Mount Isabel de Torres.
name: Amber Cove Cruise Port
address: Maimón, 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: The Parque Central is a great place to relax and people watch in Puerto Plata. It's also home to a number of historical buildings and is decorated for Christmas each year. The square is full of beautiful flowers, trees, and pigeons, which add to the local atmosphere. The people here are super nice and welcoming, making it a great place to explore on your trip to the Dominican Republic.
name: Independence Park
address: C. Beller, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Fun City offers an exhilarating go-karting experience for both kids and adults. The venue features multiple tracks where visitors can enjoy driving around for 7 minutes per ride. While the carts may not be top-of-the-line, the thrill of the experience is undeniable. Families can opt for single or double cars, with options for slower rides suitable for younger children. Although there are no on-site snack facilities, visitors are welcome to bring their own refreshments to enjoy in the designated seating area.
name: Fun City
address: P9W7+2V6, fun city, Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic

name: Taíno Bay Cruise Port
address: Av. Antigua Via Férrea Muelle Turístico entre Av. Penetración Portuaria y, Calle Duarte, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

name: La Mansión de Trujillo
address: G9WH+V59, La Cumbre 51000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Paseo de Doña Blanca, also known as Pink Street or Calle Rosada, is a charming and vibrant street in Puerto Plata. It was named after Blanca Franceschini Rainieri, a resilient Italian-Dominican mother who played a significant role in the city's tourist industry. The street features Victorian-style architecture and is entirely painted in various shades of pink, creating a picturesque setting that's perfect for photography enthusiasts.
name: Paseo de Doña Blanca
address: C. Beller No.30, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic

detail_description: Hacienda Cufa, an ecotourism destination known for its organic chocolate route, is situated in the butterfly area of Guananico municipality. Upon arrival, visitors are captivated by the beauty of the place, particularly those who have a fondness for nature. This enchanting location offers the opportunity to indulge in organic chocolate tasting and gain insights into its production process.
name: Hacienda Cufa
address: P3PG+H6J, Unnamed Rd, Guananico 57000, Dominican Republic

name: La Confluencia Galería Etnográfica
address: C. 12 de Julio 39, Puerto Plata 57000, Dominican Republic
